fields.name: The Beginner's Cave
fields.description: The Beginner's Cave has been set up by the Warlord as a service to all Free Adventurers, giving them a chance to try their skills in a not-too-dangerous setting.
fields.full_description:
Let us all toast the Warlord for restocking the cave daily!

Only beginners are supposed to enter the cave (but any character can). Knight Marshall William Misslefire is on duty to prevent inexperienced adventurers from doing anything really foolish (like entering the cave with no weapon at all!).

To return to the Main Hall, just leave the cave (by getting to the cave entrance and moving north). Once you have done so, Sam Slicker, the local dealer for treasures and booty, will pay you in gold for any items that you have collected (with the price adjusted slightly depending upon your charisma).

CONVERSION NOTES:

This is the true and original Beginner's Cave and actually the first Classic Eamon adventure, written by Donald Brown nearly three decades ago. In an attempt to preserve the flavor of the Classic Eamon experience, very little new content was added upon conversion to Eamon Deluxe conversion. Just the standard Eamon Deluxe enhancements and the addition of a few embedded artifacts which were  already hinted at in the descriptions. Although designed as a simple outing for new characters, the Beginner's Cave captures the unique experience of Eamon very well and is, in many ways, one of the best adventures ever written for it.

fields.name: You are at the cave entrance. (N/S)
fields.description: The entrance is to the south with a sign over it reading, "Beginners Only!". To the north is the road back to town.

fields.name: You are in a dark north/south tunnel.
fields.description: To the north you see bright light streaming in from the outside. To the south you see flickering torch light, but you cannot make out any details.

fields.name: You are in the west side chamber. (E)
fields.description: It is very cold here and the only light comes in dimly from the large chamber to the east.

fields.name: You are in a large chamber. (N/S/E/W)
fields.description: You are in a huge chamber where the roof rises out of sight. Burning torches line the walls making it easy to see. Tunnels lead north and south, and there are small chambers to the east and west.

fields.name: You are in the east side chamber. (W)
fields.description: It is very cold here and the only light comes in dimly from the large chamber to the west.

fields.name: You are in a west cell. (E)
fields.description: You are in a small stark cell with a door on the east side of the room.

fields.name: You are at the north end of a long passage. (N/S/E/W)
fields.description: A tunnel goes north and east and west are doors that are bolted shut. (Locking something in?). In the dim light you can see that the hall goes south but you cannot make out any details.

fields.name: You are in an east cell. (W)
fields.description: You are in a small stark cell with a door on the west side of the room.

fields.name: You are in a west cell. (E)
fields.description: You are in a small stark cell with a door on the east side.

fields.name: You are at the middle of a long passage. (N/S/E/W)
fields.description: Doors are bolted on both sides of you (east and west). The hall extends north and south.

fields.name: You are in an east cell. (W)
fields.description: You are in a small stark cell with a door on the west side.

fields.name: You are in a west cell. (E)
fields.description: You are in a small stark cell with a door on the east side.

fields.name: You are at the south end of a long passage. (N/S/E/W)
fields.description: To your great shock there are doors to the east and west. The hall goes north from here and a broken tunnel goes south.

fields.name: You are in an east cell. (W)
fields.description: You are in a small stark cell with a door on the west side.

fields.name: You are in a broken north/south tunnel.
fields.description: The sides of the tunnel are very broken and rough. You see torch light to the south. The east wall has a smooth shape in the center, about the size of a door.

fields.name: You are in an east/west tunnel with faint music.
fields.description: You are in a secret east/west passage. You hear a faint melody coming from the east.

fields.name: You are in an east/west tunnel with loud music.
fields.description: You can very clearly hear religious music being played and can smell incense from the east.

fields.name: You are at the temple. (W)
fields.description: You are in a temple that has paintings of great deeds covering the walls. There are two altars here, one covered with gold paint and the other stained with blood. The only exit leads to the west.

fields.name: You are in the library. (E)
fields.description: You are in what was obviously once a library. Most of the books have been destroyed, with the scraps left lying on the ground. A door, torn from its hinges, also lies on the floor. The exit is to the east.

fields.name: You are at a T-intersection; North by E/W.
fields.description: A brightly burning torch is bolted to the south wall. Dark tunnels lead north and east. To the west is a place where once a door stood, but it has been torn from its hinges.

fields.name: You are in an east/west tunnel.
fields.description: You are in an unremarkable tunnel. You can see torch light in both directions.

fields.name: You are at the top of a stairway. (W/D)
fields.description: You are at an unremarkable stone landing at the top of a flight of stairs. A single torch is bolted to the wall. A tunnel heads back west. It looks very dark down there...

fields.name: You are at the bottom of a stairway. (E/U)
fields.description: You are at an unremarkable stone landing at the bottom of a flight of stairs. A light can be seen at the top and a very dim light can be seen down the tunnel to the east.

fields.name: You are in an east/west tunnel.
fields.description: You are in a very rough tunnel carved out of a series of natural caverns. Dim light can be seen in both directions.

fields.name: You are in an east/west tunnel smelling of salt.
fields.description: You see light to the east, and feel a cool wind coming from there. In the wind you smell a hint of salt.

fields.name: You are in the Pirate's Cove. (E/W)
fields.description: You are at a small bay. Cliffs rise on either side of you so that the only exit is back in the tunnel to the west. A broken old boat is resting on the bank of the rough and stormy sea. All around you is salt water, as far as the eye can see.

fields.name: diamonds
fields.description: You see a large pile of gleaming diamonds here!

fields.name: axe
fields.description: You see a standard Marcos axe here.

fields.name: bottle
fields.description: There is a bottle with a strange potion inside of it here! It has a label stuck to it that you could READ.

fields.name: sword
fields.description: There is a poor quality Marcos sword here.

fields.name: sack of coins
fields.description: You find a sack with 50 gold coins inside!

fields.name: ring
fields.description: As the Mimic dies, it rolls over and you find an unmarked gold ring!

fields.name: mace
fields.description: There is a high quality Marcos mace here.

fields.name: spices
fields.description: You find several spices. They are of a rare variety and quite valuable.

fields.name: book
fields.description: There is an old book here. It glows in the darkness and is remarkably well preserved.

fields.name: TrollsFire
fields.description: The Pirate was carrying a beautiful sword. Carved on the hilt, in intricate detail, is the sword's name, "TrollsFire".

fields.name: jewels
fields.description: There is a large pile of jewels here!

fields.name: chest
fields.description: There is a large chest in the center of the room.

fields.name: empty bottle
fields.description: The healing potion is now empty. (This item never shows up in the Eamon Deluxe version).

fields.name: a secret passage east
fields.description: You've found a hidden tunnel going off to the east!

fields.name: salt water
fields.description: The water tastes salty, but doesn't appear to be poisonous.

fields.name: dead rat
fields.description: You see the hacked up body of what was once a huge rat.

fields.name: Priest's body
fields.description: The Priest's corpse lies on the floor, his face frozen in a fanatic's sneer.

fields.name: Cynthia's body
fields.description: Cynthia's body lies sprawled here, a pitiful sight.

fields.name: Hermit's body
fields.description: You see the hermit's smelly body lying crumpled on the floor.

fields.name: dead gorilla
fields.description: You see the shaggy corpse of a dead gorilla.

fields.name: Heinrich's body
fields.description: Heinrich's broken body lies on the floor here. You can still picture that sticker saying, "Hi, I'm Heinrich!"

fields.name: dead Mimic
fields.description: The dead Mimic lies in a formless blob on the floor.

fields.name: Pirate's body
fields.description: The body of the Pirate, his fine-looking clothing now slashed and bloody, lies here.

fields.name: boat
fields.description: This must be the boat the pirate used to travel to and from the cove from his ship. It currently has a large hole in it and is quite useless.

fields.name: inscription
fields.description: You see an inscription on the wall which reads, "You can type GET ALL to pick up everything in the room. This will usually not pick up dead bodies or immovable objects like doors and inscriptions."

fields.name: inscription
fields.description: An inscription on the wall reads, "The instructions often show commands in all caps for emphasis, but commands are not case sensitive."

fields.name: inscription
fields.description: Written on the wall are the words, "Most commands can be abbreviated. For example, AT DR is the same as ATTACK DRAGON, and DR PO is the same as DRINK POTION."

fields.name: writing
fields.description: You see some words chiseled into the wall: "To repeat the last command, just hit the Enter key again. To recall previous commands, use the up and down arrow keys."

fields.name: inscription
fields.description: There are some words written here: "Interesting items are sometimes hidden (embedded) within the description of the room. For example, try looking at the boat in the bay. You can also find secret doors by looking at unusual features in the room, like rough walls, cracks, bookshelves, etc."

fields.name: writing
fields.description: You see some words carved into the wall: "You may change weapons by using the READY command, e.g., READY SWORD. You may wear armor and shields using the WEAR command (e.g., WEAR CHAIN MAIL) and take them off with the REMOVE command."

fields.text: As you approach the chest, it suddenly comes alive and two tentacles come out of the sides, holding you fast. Another tentacle rises from the top and attempts to hurt you.
As the Pirate mutters a word you can't hear, bright green flames surround the blade of his sword.
As the Pirate chokes and dies, the flame on his sword also dies.
As you say the sword's name, bright green flames appear around the blade.
Since you were carrying the sword when it flamed on, you took some burn damage until the sword (hearing your cries of pain?) extinguished its flame.
As you say the sword's name, the bright green flame disappears from it.
As you read the book, you feel a weird sensation overtaking you. You are turning into a small fish!
You have no trouble finding a horse that you, well, borrow to take you to the sight of your first adventure. You follow several signs which lead you to the Beginner's Cave.
He shakes his head and says, "You must have at least one weapon to enter the cave! Go back to the Main Hall."
As you stand there, the local Knight Marshal comes out to inspect you.

The Knight Marshal says, "This adventure is for beginners only. Aren't you a little too experienced for this?" He shakes his head. "But, they're not paying me enough to keep people out. Just don't tell anyone I saw you." He turns and walks away.
Eventually the Knight Marshal says, "You may now proceed." He then walks away.

fields.name: Rat
fields.description: You see three huge rats charging at you! One is black, one is brown, and one is tan. Each one has sharp white teeth.

fields.name: Priest
fields.description: There is a huge man in religious garb with an insane look on his face here. In his right hand, he carries a mace.

fields.name: Cynthia
fields.description: You see a beautiful girl in a flowing white dress. You recognize her as Cynthia Luxom, Duke Luxom's not-too-bright daughter.

fields.name: Hermit
fields.description: There is a grizzled old hermit (who smells as if he hasn't taken a bath in forty years) in the room.

fields.name: Gorilla
fields.description: There is a huge, hairy, strong and angry gorilla in the room with you!

fields.name: Heinrich
fields.description: A human warrior stands before you, armed with a longsword and carrying a shield. On his shield is a sticker which says, "Hi, I'm Heinrich!"

fields.name: Mimic
fields.description: A chest-shaped monster is in the room, holding you with two tentacles and attempting to disassemble you with a third one.

fields.name: Pirate
fields.description: You see a man with a beard and a brass ring in his ear. He is wearing clothes made out of silk and is wielding a very fancily engraved sword.

fields.question: The Beginner's Cave -- How can I keep from getting burned?

fields.answer: Note the non-standard command (TROLLSFIRE) in this adventure.  This is used in place of SAY TROLLSFIRE and it will... Well, you will just have to figure that part out for yourself!
You must READY TrollsFire before you activate it, then it won't burn you.

If you are wondering what the TROLLSFIRE command is for: the TrollsFire sword normally does 1D6 of damage, but it magically changes to 1D10 if you activate it with the TROLLSFIRE command. (It will say "glowing" in your INVENTORY if activated.)
